required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Study to Evaluate the Microbial Consortia of Infants (9-12 Months) Experiencing Diaper Rash and When Healthy

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the microbiome composition of infant's (9-12 month) skin experiencing diaper rash in order to determine if the onset and severity of erythema associated with diaper rash is influenced by the type of bacteria colonizing the skin.

primary_outcome.measure: Operational Taxonomic Units (OTUs) of microbes present on skin
Relative abundance of microbes present on skin measured in picograms of DNA

biospec_descr.textblock: swabs and tape strips of the diaper rash area will be analyzed

study_pop.textblock: Community sample of male and female infants with mild to moderate diaper rash

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants aged 9-12 months with mild to moderate diaper rash
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of topical or oral antibiotics or antifungals within the past 4 weeks.
- Use of zinc-containing diaper rash creams within 48 hours first sample
- Immunocompromised

reference.citation: Costello EK, Lauber CL, Hamady M, Fierer N, Gordon JI, Knight R. Bacterial community variation in human body habitats across space and time. Science. 2009 Dec 18;326(5960):1694-7. doi: 10.1126/science.1177486. Epub 2009 Nov 5.
